data.text:
PAL continues to fly you safely. Here's a quick guide to know who are allowed to travel during the latest Metro Manila quarantine rules.

Please check the travel regulations in the gov't website of your destination for more info.

For updates, visit https://t.co/oJ9c6pOJq8 https://t.co/dlCUjDtii9

urls.title: Philippine Airlines
urls.description: Fly confidently with Philippine Airlines' signature heartfelt service at affordable fares

data.text:
You can still fly PAL to and from the Philippines. Here’s a guide on who are allowed to travel during the latest Metro Manila quarantine rules.

Please check the travel regulations in the gov't website of your destination for more info.

For updates, visit https://t.co/oJ9c6pOJq8 https://t.co/62bke13yqX

Philippine Airlines is mounting a special flight to Dubai on July 29, 2021. 
 
https://t.co/YNz7lERxZ3 https://t.co/dii5J2wmfb
PAL to accept OFWs on flights to Saudi Arabia https://t.co/SHW2OPfZGn
ADVISORY TO PASSENGERS ON FLIGHTS TO KSA  https://t.co/8YHG262lYe

domain.name: Person
domain.description: Named people in the world like Nelson Mandela

data.text:
Starting June 1, 2021, PAL Los Angeles flights will be forced, over our protest, to depart and arrive in the new midfield gates of LAX Airport. 

Click here to learn more: https://t.co/hLjyAz2nIR https://t.co/P5ub12MIYe

ALERT: Transfer of PAL Los Angeles flights to new LAX midfield gates from June 1 

Read more:     https://t.co/wnVkZjsSvz

Philippine Airlines is an active partner of government, transporting vaccines into the Philippines and throughout the archipelago.
PAL's mission to serve continues.
#DutytoCountry #FlyPAL #FlySafePH https://t.co/aADrD5ZrJ9

PR359 touches down in Manila at 5:10PM carrying 500K Sinovac vaccine doses from Beijing.

#HeartoftheFilipino https://t.co/tWbcRXe2aU

A dedicated team is working on it to expedite the process. Kindly visit https://t.co/I5tj41dq5N for more information. Thank you.

(2/2)

Last March 17, PAL's A321neo flew across the Indochina region and airlifted more Filipinos home from Yangon and Phnom Penh. In partnership with the Philippine government, the flag carrier continues to reunite our countrymen with their families.
#DutytoCountry #FlyPAL #FlySafePH https://t.co/35GufVyB99

Philippine Airlines, in support of the national government, airlifts 1,000,000 doses of Sinovac vaccines from Beijing to Manila. The flag carrier vows to do its part in working towards the healing of the country. #DutytoCountry #FlyPAL #FlySafePH https://t.co/LZtjhtPV1X

data.text:
Philippine Airlines airlifted 400,000 doses of Sinovac vaccine from Beijing to Manila. PAL's biggest aircraft, a Boeing 777-300ER with massive cargo-hauling capability, carried the donations earmarked for frontline workers throughout the Philippines. 
 #DutytoCountry #FlySafePH https://t.co/eYZMZqe9s6
More canceled international flights due to PH government restrictions. Learn more here: https://t.co/NHl0oNiMML https://t.co/Xt7QbveVkK

urls.title: Arriving in Philippines
urls.description: International passengers must follow the arrival procedures of their PH port of entry mandated by PAL and the Philippine Government. Unvaccinated, partially vaccinated, and passengers whose vaccination status cannot be verified shall be required to complete a facility-based quarantine at the first port of entry into the Philippines, regardless the onward domestic destination. Ensure to check your first PH arrival airport prior to booking the facility. Last updated: PH Local Time, June 15, 2022 Travel

data.text:
The Philippine government has revised arrival quarantine protocols for travelers arriving in the Philippines starting February 1, 2021. 

Here’s a step-by-step guide  so you can prepare ahead for a worry-free trip.​ ​ 

To learn more, visit https://t.co/DBw8XopwCW https://t.co/XKnWmA5ZmB

data.text:
In partnership with Guide to the Philippines, we bring you EASY ESCAPES - the easy way to travel in the better normal! 

Learn more: https://t.co/XOdvPqJbNW https://t.co/yfTyUzZ5RS

We recognize that this has taken some time, and we greatly appreciate your understanding as we continue to resolve these challenges over the coming months. Again, our sincerest apologies for the delay. 

(3/3)

The loss of revenues deprived us of liquidity to make prompt refund payments, even as lockdown restrictions posed serious staffing and logistical limitations.

(2/3)
PAL Flights for October and beyond  https://t.co/6iLDSDXJr5
Message to our customers on refunds:  https://t.co/0qRWfWilgG
ALERT/REMINDER – NEW MALAYSIAN ENTRY RESTRICTIONS  https://t.co/V2sA73LcPV

data.text: Attention:  Passengers departing from Dubai and Doha on Aug 13 and passengers departing from Singapore and Dammam on Aug 14 https://t.co/2OHic60htR
Effective from August 15, 2020, all passengers are required to wear both face shields as well as face masks to comply with Philippine Department of Transportation regulations. https://t.co/MNVkVpjeCv

Effective from Aug. 15, 2020, Philippine Airlines will require all passengers to wear face shields, on top of the mandatory face masks, in compliance with the Philippine Department of Transportation's latest guidelines for the public transport sector. https://t.co/gdEbyCONgv

All regular scheduled domestic flights to and from Manila from August 4 to 18, 2020 are canceled in line with the Philippine Government's classification of Metro Manila as a Modified Enhanced Community Quarantine (MECQ) area for this 14-day period. https://t.co/nLdQogx5Xf

Rest assured we will update you on any changes. 
Please continue to check our travel advisories for developments. 
Thank you for your understanding.

Please see this link: https://t.co/rfUgiikP3j
PAL finalizing plans for June 2020 flights https://t.co/N5Dp6AsjLa

Are you preparing to #flyPAL soon? For a faster experience at the airport, please ensure that your carry-on bag is within these specifications. Click here to find out more about guidelines on safe travels: https://t.co/mKyyWra7m0 https://t.co/xG10utB4M6

entity.name: COVID-19: Latest news updates from around the world
entity.description: This page is a timeline of Tweets with the latest information and updates on COVID-19 from experts, journalists, health authorities and other trusted sources from around the world. For more on COVID-19, visit: twitter.com/explore/tabs/covid-19

data.text: To all international passengers arriving in the Philippines: The PH  gov’t is implementing stricter quarantine & testing procedures for all arriving passengers, effective immediately, under a new directive from the IATF on COVID-19.  https://t.co/s4HMUBglGA

Closure of PH airports for international arrivals from May 3 to 9. 

The Philippine Government has announced the closure of international arrival facilities at all Philippine airports from May 3 (Sunday) at 8:00 AM for a one-week period.

Learn more: https://t.co/uRWZMqL3B1 https://t.co/9p9jjYkN1y

This modified ‘customer journey’ is rooted in our mission to provide you with a reassuring travel experience, following the highest health and safety standards. Here is what you can expect from us to ensure that you enjoy a healthy, safe, and clean environment when we fly again. https://t.co/qSBTUEtPSs

We want to be the safest airline in the air. As we get ready to resume regular flights to serve passengers with urgent travel needs, Philippine Airlines is redefining our products and services to add more health protection measures. 
Learn more: https://t.co/KZ556hEHZh https://t.co/WVzdW9bmzC

We confirm that all Philippine Airlines domestic and international flights are cancelled up to May 15, 2020, in line with the extension of the Luzon Enhanced Community Quarantine until May 15th. https://t.co/399wFUnBEy

PAL mounts such sweeper flights to fly home foreign nationals. These charter flights are arranged by the concerned Embassies. Such prices are coordinated by PAL and the concerned Embassy, and aim only to recover the high cost of these special operations.

We apologize for erroneously suggesting, in a reply to a tweet from a concerned traveler, that the Dept of Tourism has control over the pricing of repatriation flights. DOT assists tourists with info on local transport access but is not responsible for the pricing of air tickets.
Starting Monday, April 13, 2020, PAL Customer Hotlines will be open to serve you 12 hours per day, 7 days a week. https://t.co/2Z2sWBKp4x
Rest assured that we are doing our best to respond to your messages in a timely manner.

However, due to an extremely high volume of calls, we've created an option for people to register with PAL at https://t.co/Y4rVkEz373. We will take down their info & contact them shortly. PAL will continues to work diligently from 8am to 8pm throughout the Easter holiday period.

Notice for CANADIANS in the Philippines:  

Philippine Airlines has opened a dedicated phone number to manage bookings for the April 14 special flights to Toronto and Vancouver organized by the Canadian Embassy.

Flight Advisory: Philippine Airlines will operate special flights from Toronto and Vancouver to Manila on April 14, 2020 using Airbus A350 aircraft.

Learn more here: https://t.co/lkGKh66J3G https://t.co/11LwxPlqIm

FLIGHT ADVISORY: We confirm that all Philippine Airlines domestic and international flights are cancelled up to April 30, 2020, in line with the extension of the Luzon Enhanced Community Quarantine until April 30.

Learn more: https://t.co/zVx0hEV8K7 https://t.co/6hwV22a6AS
PAL Rolls Out Travel Voucher with Bonus Value, and Unlimited Rebooking https://t.co/xUpGpZZQAa

data.text:
Philippine Airlines is mounting a single round-trip flight between Manila and London Heathrow on April 4 in response to an urgent public need amid COVID-19 quarantine situation.
https://t.co/HeTNS4oI8Z

Submit your rebooking, travel voucher or refund requests in 3 easy steps:

1. Fill up the form at https://t.co/neg1mj1yFn
2. Click SUBMIT
3. Receive the confirmation of your request via email in 5-7 business days.. Click here:  https://t.co/neg1mj1yFn https://t.co/Y4BUhyo8no

data.text: Pause in PAL Operations – COVID-19 Situation https://t.co/W0eQEXAs96
PAL International Flights March 23 to March 31 https://t.co/YAkDfObZUg

No need to worry about your flights during uncertain times. With myPAL Travel Voucher, you can now convert your unused ticket value for use on a later date, a new flight or even travel extras.

Learn more here: https://t.co/dkatdArGIT https://t.co/DAC2QVg62w
Updated 22Mar: PAL International Flights https://t.co/Ka0bqgbjnx
PAL International flights operating until March 31, 2020. Learn more here: https://t.co/ZmbR310XRP https://t.co/QPOa4Q07JS
Updated: PAL International Flights March 20 to March 31 https://t.co/ul9Yp4sPdq

Please bear with us and postpone your queries and transactions so we can serve you better at a later date.  Please monitor our periodic updates on PAL social media pages and our website.
Thank you!

Customer calls are up by over 1,000%; call waiting time is uncomfortably long and most calls fail to come through. The sole ticket office cannot accommodate any more customers without compromising public health and safety.

The ban on public transportation and strict checkpoint restrictions prevent us from deploying a full staff at the call center and ticket office, although we continue to set up alternative arrangements. (Under the Luzon quarantine, we are allowed to open only one ticket ofc in MM)
We wish to appeal to our dear PAL passengers to please refrain from calling our customer Hotline (+63 2) 8855 8888) or visiting our Ticket Office at this time, except for urgent concerns.
REQUEST TO DECONGEST HOTLINE AND TICKET OFFICE  https://t.co/cu42iOlPz9

PAL STATEMENT : 
https://t.co/diVHYQsK6Z
IMPORTANT NOTICE ON STATUS OF PAL FLIGHTS https://t.co/GZ8BQct56T
Cancellation of BACOLOD FLIGHTS to/from Cebu/Clark from MAR 16 - 18 https://t.co/ckyzZm9QBR
Arrangements for International Passengers at NAIA (Manila airport) https://t.co/kDt3UMVgbV
Reminder to Wear Face Masks on Flights to/from Vietnam https://t.co/jXj8AtSFm8
We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience and thank you for your kind cooperation during this very challenging time.
